title: UAE: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi to inaugurate the largest Hindu temple in Abu Dhabi on this date - Culture
text:
UAE: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi to inaugurate the largest Hindu temple in Abu Dhabi on this date Indian PM will inaugurate the BAPS Hindu temple on February 14, 2024 by Afreen Shaikh Dec. 29, 2023
> Culture
The United Arab Emirates is set to witness the inaugural of the iconic BAPS Hindu Mandir in Abu Dhabi, next year.
Read also : Dubai RTA announces free parking on New Year’s Day holiday
The much-awaited opening of the region’s first traditional Hindu stone temple, the BAPS Hindu Mandir in Abu Dhabi will be marked with a unique ‘Festival of Harmony’ on February 14, 2024.
Visuals of BAPS Hindu Mandir @AbuDhabiMandir being constructed in Abu Dhabi. These are visuals from September.
Csty: BAPS temple authorities https://t.co/oAmBPg1Or3 pic.twitter.com/sjtKTwdM76
— Sidhant Sibal (@sidhant) December 28, 2023 According to the Khaleej Times, Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi accepted the invitation to inaugurate the historic Hindu temple which was extended by Pujya Swami Ishwarcharandas and Swami Brahmaviharidas, along with the board of directors.
As per BAPS Swaminarayan Sanstha, the organization building the temple, Indian PM Modi will visit the capital of the United Arab Emirates to witness the opening of the BAPS Hindu Mandir.
Swami Ishwarcharandas and Swami Brahmaviharidas met Narendra Modi at his official residence at 7 Lok Kalyan Marg in New Delhi, India, along with the board of directors on behalf of the temple to extend an invitation to inaugurate the BAPS Hindu Mandir.
“Prime Minister Modi graciously accepted the invitation,” the temple representatives said, “expressing his enthusiastic support for the historic and iconic temple.”
BAPS also shared an image of PM Modi accepting the invitation from Swami Ishwarcharandas and Swami Brahmaviharidas on their social media platform.
PM Modi accepts invitation to inaugurate the BAPS Hindu Mandir in Abu Dhabi, Delhi, India https://t.co/4OjdYUOm4u pic.twitter.com/ZluAL4xWDK
— BAPS (@BAPS) December 28, 2023 As per the statement, Narendra Modi highlighted that the opening of BAPS Hindu Mandir would promote the message of “Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam,” which is a Sanskrit phrase, meaning- “The World Is One Family.”
Meanwhile, a Vedic ceremony will be held as part of the opening and will led by His Holiness Pujya Mahant Swami Maharaj. It will be an invitation-only event.
The BAPS Hindu Mandir is built on 27 acres of land in Abu Mureikha, Abu Dhabi, the UAE under the supervision of temple head Swami Brahmaviharidas. It will be made open to the public on February 18, 2024.
